articles.title: 50 Czech Compliments for Your Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Czech people may seem reserved at first, but they have a wonderfully rich vocabulary for expressing admiration. Learning to compliment your Czech partner in their native language will truly warm their heart.

## The Most Beautiful Compliment

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Jsi n√°dhern√°"
  translation="You are gorgeous (to a woman)"
  pronunciation="See NAD-her-na"
  context="One of the most beautiful compliments in Czech. 'N√°dhern√°' conveys exceptional, breathtaking beauty."
/>

In Czech culture, sincere compliments carry real meaning. They're not given lightly, making them all the more special when received.

## Complimenting Appearance

### For Women

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi kr√°sn√°"
  translation="You are beautiful"
  pronunciation="See KRAS-na"
  example="Jsi dnes moc kr√°sn√°!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi n√°dhern√°"
  translation="You are gorgeous"
  pronunciation="See NAD-her-na"
  example="Vypad√°≈° n√°dhernƒõ!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi okouzluj√≠c√≠"
  translation="You are charming/enchanting"
  pronunciation="See o-KOW-zlu-yee-tsee"
  example="Jsi tak okouzluj√≠c√≠!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi p≈Øvabn√°"
  translation="You are graceful/lovely"
  pronunciation="See POO-vab-na"
  example="Jsi velmi p≈Øvabn√°."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi √∫≈æasn√°"
  translation="You are amazing"
  pronunciation="See OO-zhas-na"
  example="Jsi prostƒõ √∫≈æasn√°!"
/>

### For Men

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi hezk√Ω"
  translation="You are handsome"
  pronunciation="See HEZ-kee"
  example="Jsi velmi hezk√Ω!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi p≈ôita≈æliv√Ω"
  translation="You are attractive"
  pronunciation="See przhee-TAZH-li-vee"
  example="Jsi velmi p≈ôita≈æliv√Ω mu≈æ."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi mu≈æn√Ω"
  translation="You are manly"
  pronunciation="See MOOZH-nee"
  example="Jsi tak mu≈æn√Ω!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi elegantn√≠"
  translation="You are elegant"
  pronunciation="See e-le-GANT-nee"
  example="Dnes vypad√°≈° elegantnƒõ!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Gender Agreement" flag="üá®üáø">
Czech adjectives change based on gender. Words ending in "-√Ω" are masculine, while "-√°" endings are feminine. Using the correct form shows respect for your partner and the language!
</CultureTip>

## Complimenting Specific Features

### Eyes

<VocabCard
  word="M√°≈° kr√°sn√© oƒçi"
  translation="You have beautiful eyes"
  pronunciation="Mash KRAS-ne O-chi"
  example="M√°≈° tak kr√°sn√© oƒçi!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tvoje oƒçi jsou jako hvƒõzdy"
  translation="Your eyes are like stars"
  pronunciation="TVO-ye O-chi SOW ya-ko HVYEZ-di"
  example="Romantic and poetic!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Top√≠m se v tv√Ωch oƒç√≠ch"
  translation="I'm drowning in your eyes"
  pronunciation="TO-peem se f tveekh O-cheekh"
  example="A deeply romantic expression."
/>

### Smile

<VocabCard
  word="M√°≈° kr√°sn√Ω √∫smƒõv"
  translation="You have a beautiful smile"
  pronunciation="Mash KRAS-nee OO-smyev"
  example="Tv≈Øj √∫smƒõv mi rozjasn√≠ den."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi kr√°sn√°, kdy≈æ se usm√≠v√°≈°"
  translation="You're beautiful when you smile"
  pronunciation="See KRAS-na, kdish se us-MEE-vash"
  example="For a woman."
/>

### Voice

<VocabCard
  word="M√°≈° kr√°sn√Ω hlas"
  translation="You have a beautiful voice"
  pronunciation="Mash KRAS-nee hlas"
  example="R√°d/a poslouch√°m tv≈Øj hlas."
/>

## Personality Compliments

### Kindness and Character

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi hodn√Ω/hodn√°"
  translation="You are kind (m/f)"
  pronunciation="See HOD-nee / HOD-na"
  example="Jsi tak hodn√° ke v≈°em."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi starostliv√Ω/starostliv√°"
  translation="You are caring (m/f)"
  pronunciation="See sta-ROST-li-vee / sta-ROST-li-va"
  example="Jsi tak starostliv√Ω partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi ohledupln√Ω/ohledupln√°"
  translation="You are considerate (m/f)"
  pronunciation="See o-HLED-up-lnee / o-HLED-up-lna"
  example="Jsi v≈ædy tak ohledupln√Ω."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="M√°≈° zlat√© srdce"
  translation="You have a heart of gold"
  pronunciation="Mash ZLA-te SERD-tse"
  example="A beautiful expression of admiration."
/>

### Intelligence and Talent

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi chytr√Ω/chytr√°"
  translation="You are smart (m/f)"
  pronunciation="See KHIT-ree / KHIT-ra"
  example="Jsi tak chytr√°!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi talentovan√Ω/talentovan√°"
  translation="You are talented (m/f)"
  pronunciation="See ta-len-TO-va-nee / ta-len-TO-va-na"
  example="Jsi neuvƒõ≈ôitelnƒõ talentovan√Ω!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi geni√°ln√≠"
  translation="You are a genius"
  pronunciation="See ge-ni-AL-nee"
  example="Ten n√°pad je geni√°ln√≠, jako ty!"
/>

### Humor and Fun

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi vtipn√Ω/vtipn√°"
  translation="You are funny (m/f)"
  pronunciation="See VTIP-nee / VTIP-na"
  example="Jsi tak vtipn√Ω!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="S tebou je legrace"
  translation="It's fun being with you"
  pronunciation="S TE-bow ye LEG-ra-tse"
  example="S tebou je v≈ædycky legrace!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Czech Directness" flag="üá®üáø">
Czechs value sincerity over flattery. A genuine, heartfelt compliment means more than excessive praise. When you compliment someone, mean it - Czechs can easily spot insincerity!
</CultureTip>

## Romantic Compliments

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi moje ≈°tƒõst√≠"
  translation="You are my happiness"
  pronunciation="See MO-ye SHTYES-tee"
  example="Jsi cel√© moje ≈°tƒõst√≠."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dƒõl√°≈° mƒõ ≈°≈•astn√Ωm/≈°≈•astnou"
  translation="You make me happy (m/f speaker)"
  pronunciation="DYEL-ash mnye SHTYAST-neem / SHTYAST-now"
  example="Ka≈æd√Ω den mƒõ dƒõl√°≈° ≈°≈•astn√Ωm."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi to nejlep≈°√≠, co mƒõ potkalo"
  translation="You're the best thing that happened to me"
  pronunciation="See to NEY-lep-shee, tso mnye POT-ka-lo"
  example="The ultimate romantic compliment."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsem na tebe hrd√Ω/hrd√°"
  translation="I'm proud of you (m/f speaker)"
  pronunciation="Sem na TE-be HER-dee / HER-da"
  example="Jsem na tebe tak hrd√°!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="S tebou se c√≠t√≠m v√Ωjimeƒçn√Ω/v√Ωjimeƒçn√°"
  translation="I feel special when I'm with you (m/f)"
  pronunciation="S TE-bow se TSEE-teem VEE-yi-mech-nee / VEE-yi-mech-na"
  example="Express how they make you feel."
/>

## Complimenting Actions and Efforts

<VocabCard
  word="Va≈ô√≠≈° bo≈æsky"
  translation="You cook divinely"
  pronunciation="VA-rzheesh BOZH-ski"
  example="Tohle j√≠dlo je bo≈æsk√©!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="V≈°echno dƒõl√°≈° perfektnƒõ"
  translation="You do everything perfectly"
  pronunciation="VSHEKH-no DYEL-ash per-FEKT-nye"
  example="Admire their efforts."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="L√≠b√≠ se mi, jak to dƒõl√°≈°"
  translation="I like how you do this"
  pronunciation="LEE-bee se mi, yak to DYEL-ash"
  example="Acknowledge their unique way."
/>

## Poetic Comparisons

Czechs appreciate poetic expressions:

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi kr√°sn√° jako r≈Ø≈æe"
  translation="You're beautiful like a rose"
  pronunciation="See KRAS-na ya-ko ROO-zhe"
  example="Classic romantic comparison."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Z√°≈ô√≠≈° jako slunce"
  translation="You shine like the sun"
  pronunciation="ZA-rzheesh ya-ko SLUN-tse"
  example="You brighten everything."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jsi jako andƒõl"
  translation="You're like an angel"
  pronunciation="See ya-ko AN-dyel"
  example="Jsi m≈Øj andƒõl!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Flowers in Czech Culture" flag="üá®üáø">
Like many Central European countries, Czechs often give flowers with compliments. Remember: always give an odd number of flowers - even numbers are reserved for funerals.
</CultureTip>

## Responding to Compliments

When your partner compliments you, here's how to respond:

| Czech | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| Dƒõkuji | DYE-ku-yi | Thank you |
| Ty taky | Ti TA-ki | You too |
| Lichot√≠≈° mi | LI-kho-teesh mi | You flatter me |
| Opravdu? | OP-rav-du | Really? |
| Jsi tak mil√Ω/mil√° | See tak MI-lee / MI-la | You're so sweet |
| To je mil√© sly≈°et | To ye MI-le SLI-shet | That's nice to hear |

## Daily Compliments to Use

Make it a habit to compliment your partner daily:

| Situation | Czech | English |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| Morning | Vypad√°≈° skvƒõle | You look great |
| After cooking | Moc dobr√©! | Very delicious! |
| Getting dressed | To ti slu≈°√≠ | It suits you |
| Working hard | Jsi skvƒõl√Ω/skvƒõl√° | You're great |
| Being supportive | Dƒõkuji, ≈æe jsi | Thanks for being you |
| Before bed | M√°m ≈°tƒõst√≠, ≈æe tƒõ m√°m | I'm lucky to have you |

## Quick Reference: Essential Compliments

### For Her

| Czech | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jsi kr√°sn√° | You're beautiful |
| Jsi n√°dhern√° | You're gorgeous |
| Jsi okouzluj√≠c√≠ | You're charming |
| Jsi chytr√° | You're smart |
| Jsi hodn√° | You're kind |

### For Him

| Czech | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jsi hezk√Ω | You're handsome |
| Jsi siln√Ω | You're strong |
| Jsi mu≈æn√Ω | You're manly |
| Jsi chytr√Ω | You're smart |
| Jsi hodn√Ω | You're kind |

### Universal

| Czech | English |
|---------|---------|
| Jsi v√Ωjimeƒçn√Ω/v√Ωjimeƒçn√° | You're special |
| Jsem na tebe hrd√Ω/hrd√° | I'm proud of you |
| Jsi moje v≈°echno | You're my everything |
| S tebou je mi dob≈ôe | I feel good with you |
| Jsi nejlep≈°√≠ | You're the best |

<CTA
  text="Ready to master these compliments? With Love Languages, your partner can send you Word Gifts with compliments in authentic AI voice. Practice with AI voice chat until you're confident. Your partner becomes your tutor!"
  buttonText="Start Learning ƒåe≈°tina"
/>

articles.title: Vocabular pentru Seri Romantice √Æn SpaniolƒÉ: Ghid Complet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Spaniolii »ôtiu sƒÉ se bucure de via»õƒÉ »ôi de dragoste! O searƒÉ romanticƒÉ sau o "cita" este o artƒÉ √Æn cultura hispanicƒÉ. Acest ghid √Æ»õi oferƒÉ tot vocabularul necesar pentru a impresiona.

## Invita»õii pentru √ént√¢lniri

<PhraseOfDay
  word="¬øTe gustar√≠a salir conmigo?"
  translation="»öi-ar plƒÉcea sƒÉ ie»ôi cu mine?"
  pronunciation="te gus-ta-ri-a sa-lir con-mi-go"
  context="Modul clasic de a invita pe cineva la o √Ænt√¢lnire."
/>

### Moduri de a Invita

<VocabCard
  word="¬øQuieres cenar conmigo esta noche?"
  translation="Vrei sƒÉ cinezi cu mine √Æn seara asta?"
  pronunciation="chie-res ce-nar con-mi-go es-ta no-che"
  example="¬øQuieres cenar conmigo esta noche? Conozco un restaurante incre√≠ble."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="¬øQu√© te parece »ôi vamos a...?"
  translation="Ce zici sƒÉ mergem la...?"
  pronunciation="che te pa-re-ce »ôi va-mos a"
  example="¬øQu√© te parece »ôi vamos a ese nuevo restaurante italiano?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Me encantar√≠a llevarte a..."
  translation="Mi-ar plƒÉcea foarte mult sƒÉ te duc la..."
  pronunciation="me en-can-ta-ri-a lle-var-te a"
  example="Me encantar√≠a llevarte a un sitio especial este fin de semana."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Tengamos una cita rom√°ntica"
  translation="Hai sƒÉ avem o √Ænt√¢lnire romanticƒÉ"
  pronunciation="ten-ga-mos u-na ci-ta ro-man-ti-ca"
  example="Hace mucho que no salimos. Tengamos una cita rom√°ntica."
/>

<CultureTip title="Cultura Dating √Æn Spania" flag="üá™üá∏">
Spaniolii ies √Æn grupuri mai mult dec√¢t √Æn cuplu la √Ænceput. DacƒÉ cineva te invitƒÉ "a tomar algo" (sƒÉ lua»õi ceva), poate fi o √Ænt√¢lnire. Spaniolii nu se grƒÉbesc - rela»õiile evolueazƒÉ natural.
</CultureTip>

## La Restaurant

### Sosirea »ôi Rezervarea

<VocabCard
  word="Tenemos una reserva a nombre de..."
  translation="Avem o rezervare pe numele..."
  pronunciation="te-ne-mos u-na re-ser-va a nom-bre de"
  example="Buenas noches. Tenemos una reserva a nombre de Garc√≠a para las nueve."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Una mesa para dos, por favor"
  translation="O masƒÉ pentru doi, vƒÉ rog"
  pronunciation="u-na me-sa pa-ra dos por fa-vor"
  example="Una mesa para dos, por favor. ¬øTienen algo tranquilo?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="¬øPodemos sentarnos junto a la ventana?"
  translation="Ne putem a»ôeza l√¢ngƒÉ fereastrƒÉ?"
  pronunciation="po-de-mos sen-tar-nos hun-to a la ven-ta-na"
  example="¬øPodemos sentarnos junto a la ventana? Nos gusta la vista."
/>

### Comanda

<VocabCard
  word="¬øQu√© nos recomienda?"
  translation="Ce ne recomanda»õi?"
  pronunciation="che nos re-co-mien-da"
  example="Es nuestra primera vez aqu√≠. ¬øQu√© nos recomienda?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Para m√≠, el/la..."
  translation="Pentru mine, ..."
  pronunciation="pa-ra mi el/la"
  example="Para m√≠, la paella, por favor."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="¬øPodemos ver la carta de vinos?"
  translation="Putem vedea lista de vinuri?"
  pronunciation="po-de-mos ver la car-ta de vi-nos"
  example="Antes de pedir, ¬øpodemos ver la carta de vinos?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Queremos compartir el postre"
  translation="Vrem sƒÉ √ÆmpƒÉr»õim desertul"
  pronunciation="che-re-mos com-par-tir el pos-tre"
  example="El flan se ve delicioso. Queremos compartir el postre."
/>

### Vocabular de Restaurant

| SpaniolƒÉ | Rom√¢nƒÉ |
|----------|--------|
| El men√∫ / La carta | Meniul |
| El entrante | Aperitivul |
| El plato principal | Felul principal |
| El postre | Desertul |
| La cuenta | Nota de platƒÉ |
| La propina | Bac»ôi»ôul |
| El camarero | Chelnerul |
| La bebida | BƒÉutura |

<CultureTip title="Bac»ôi»ôul √Æn Spania" flag="üá™üá∏">
√én Spania, bac»ôi»ôul nu este obligatoriu! Serviciul este inclus. DacƒÉ e»ôti mul»õumit, po»õi lƒÉsa 5-10% sau c√¢»õiva euro, dar nu este a»ôteptat. √én America LatinƒÉ, obiceiurile variazƒÉ.
</CultureTip>

## Complimente √Æn Timpul Serii

<VocabCard
  word="Est√°s guap√≠sima/o esta noche"
  translation="ArƒÉ»õi superb/ƒÉ √Æn seara asta"
  pronunciation="es-tas gua-pi-si-ma/mo es-ta no-che"
  example="Wow, est√°s guap√≠sima esta noche. Me dejas sin palabras."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Me encanta pasar tiempo contigo"
  translation="√émi place foarte mult sƒÉ petrec timp cu tine"
  pronunciation="me en-can-ta pa-sar tiem-po con-ti-go"
  example="Sabes, me encanta pasar tiempo contigo. Siempre me haces re√≠r."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Esta noche es perfecta"
  translation="Seara asta e perfectƒÉ"
  pronunciation="es-ta no-che es per-fec-ta"
  example="Este restaurante, esta compa√±√≠a... esta noche es perfecta."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Me lo estoy pasando genial"
  translation="MƒÉ distrez de minune"
  pronunciation="me lo es-toi pa-san-do he-nial"
  example="Me lo estoy pasando genial contigo."
/>

## Conversa»õii Romantice

<VocabCard
  word="¬øRecuerdas cuando nos conocimos?"
  translation="√é»õi aminte»ôti c√¢nd ne-am cunoscut?"
  pronunciation="re-cuer-das cuan-do nos co-no-ci-mos"
  example="¬øRecuerdas cuando nos conocimos? Estaba tan nervioso."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="¬øQu√© fue lo primero que pensaste de m√≠?"
  translation="Care a fost primul lucru pe care l-ai g√¢ndit despre mine?"
  pronunciation="che fue lo pri-me-ro che pen-sas-te de mi"
  example="Siempre me he preguntado: ¬øqu√© fue lo primero que pensaste de m√≠?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Me haces muy feliz"
  translation="MƒÉ faci foarte fericit/ƒÉ"
  pronunciation="me a-ces mui fe-liz"
  example="¬øSabes qu√©? Me haces muy feliz cada d√≠a."
/>

## ActivitƒÉ»õi pentru √ént√¢lniri

| SpaniolƒÉ | Rom√¢nƒÉ | Pronun»õie |
|----------|--------|-----------|
| Cenar | A cina | ce-nar |
| Ir al cine | A merge la cinema | ir al ci-ne |
| Pasear | A se plimba | pa-se-ar |
| Bailar | A dansa | bai-lar |
| Tomar algo | A lua ceva de bƒÉut | to-mar al-go |
| Cocinar juntos | A gƒÉti √ÆmpreunƒÉ | co-ci-nar hun-tos |
| Ver las estrellas | A vedea stelele | ver las es-tre-llas |

<VocabCard
  word="¬øVamos a bailar despu√©s?"
  translation="Mergem sƒÉ dansƒÉm dupƒÉ?"
  pronunciation="va-mos a bai-lar des-pues"
  example="La noche es joven. ¬øVamos a bailar despu√©s?"
/>

## La Finalul Serii

<VocabCard
  word="Ha sido una noche incre√≠ble"
  translation="A fost o searƒÉ incredibilƒÉ"
  pronunciation="a si-do u-na no-che in-cre-i-ble"
  example="Gracias por todo. Ha sido una noche incre√≠ble."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="No quiero que termine esta noche"
  translation="Nu vreau ca seara asta sƒÉ se termine"
  pronunciation="no chie-ro che ter-mi-ne es-ta no-che"
  example="No quiero que termine esta noche. ¬øUn paseo?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="¬øRepetimos pronto?"
  translation="RepetƒÉm cur√¢nd?"
  pronunciation="re-pe-ti-mos pron-to"
  example="Me lo he pasado genial. ¬øRepetimos pronto?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Gracias por una velada maravillosa"
  translation="Mul»õumesc pentru o searƒÉ minunatƒÉ"
  pronunciation="gra-cias por u-na ve-la-da ma-ra-vi-llo-sa"
  example="Mi amor, gracias por una velada maravillosa."
/>


## Idei pentru Citas √Æn Cultura HispanicƒÉ

1. **Tapas y vino** - Mersul la mai multe baruri de tapas
2. **Paseo nocturno** - Plimbare nocturnƒÉ prin centrul ora»ôului
3. **Flamenco** - Spectacol de flamenco (√Æn Spania)
4. **Playa al atardecer** - PlajƒÉ la apus
5. **Picnic con vistas** - Picnic cu vedere
6. **Clases de baile** - Lec»õii de dans √ÆmpreunƒÉ
7. **Cena en casa** - CinƒÉ romanticƒÉ acasƒÉ

<CTA
  text="PregƒÉtit pentru o searƒÉ romanticƒÉ √Æn spaniolƒÉ?"
  buttonText="√éncepe sƒÉ √énve»õi √émpreunƒÉ"
/>

articles.title: Guia de Pron√∫ncia Italiana para Iniciantes: Aprenda a Cantar o Amor na L√≠ngua Certa
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';

Come√ßar a aprender italiano com seu amor? A pron√∫ncia italiana √© como m√∫sica - uma vez que voc√™ entende o ritmo, cada palavra soa mais rom√¢ntica.
